jobDescription: Thornton Tomasetti provides engineering design, investigation and analysis services to clients worldwide on projects of every size and level of complexity. We are a growing 1200+ person firm with practices in the following disciplines: Structural Engineering, Forensics, Applied Science, Renewal, Property Loss Consulting, Construction Engineering, Protective Design, Facade Engineering, Sustainability and Transportation. We work on landmarks to exhibitions from the historic to the high performing while balancing multiple objectives which include form, function, schedule, sustainability, constructability and budget. At our core, TALENT is the center of our business.  Thornton Tomasetti’s CORE studio consists of 18 dedicated engineers, architects, hackers and designers. CORE studio develops in-house applications for a >1200 person global engineering consultancy, builds free software for the AEC industry, performs research in and around the AEC industry, and provides computational modeling support on projects of all sizes within TT. Increasingly, we’re also investing in machine learning research and development in and around TT’s various practices and areas of expertise. A CORE studio Data Science Intern will support this internal R&D; effort, and would gain experience in generating/sourcing/cleaning data, building Machine Learning prediction models, managing large amounts of data, cloud computing, and crafting data visualizations to present insights. Some standard tasks include: Use finite element analysis, and other numerical methods to analyse and design code-compliant structural components and systems.Use constrained multi-objective optimization, and other computational methods for design space exploration and sensitivity analysis.Use data approximation and data interpolation techniques to fit reduced models for fast/approximate design space exploration.Use statistical inference (Bayesian and Markov Chain Monte Carlo methods) for probabilistic design space exploration.Prepare data visualizations to illustrate and explain analytical results.
